common_issues.title: LTM and Workstream Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users on macOS are experiencing issues with LTM and Workstream functionality, including queries not returning results, slow performance, and failure to record new activities.  Some users encounter "Pro membership required" errors despite having a Pro subscription.  Potential solutions include clearing LTM data (although the button is reported as not working), reinstalling the app, and verifying Pro subscription status.

related_issues.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
related_issues.text:
Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

common_issues.title: Pieces MCP and Desktop App Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Multiple reports indicate connection problems between Pieces OS, Desktop app, and MCP tools. Symptoms include tools failing, SSE hanging, and connection leaks attributed to the Desktop app.  Workarounds involve closing the Desktop app, restarting Pieces OS, and monitoring connections.  The core issue seems to be excessive connections originating from the Desktop app hindering MCP functionality.

related_issues.title: MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
related_issues.text:
MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS Sequoia 15.5

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

## Bug Report

**Environment:**
- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.5
- Pieces OS: 11.4.4 - Running (PID 699, actively collecting data)
- Pieces App: 4.1.4 - Active with functional LTM workstream
- MCP Server: Pieces MCP server on localhost:39300
- Test Client: Warp Terminal Agent Mode, Claude, direct curl testing

## Problem Description

The `ask_pieces_ltm` MCP tool consistently returns `"Failed to extract context"` with `"isError": true`, despite:

1. ✅ **LTM is working correctly** - User confirmed LTM is collecting data and showing results/summaries in the Pieces workstream
2. ✅ **MCP server communication works** - Can successfully call `create_pieces_memory` and list tools
3. ✅ **Pieces OS is running and active** - Process running with multiple active connections
4. ❌ **Only `ask_pieces_ltm` fails** - Every call to this specific tool fails

## Steps to Reproduce

### 1. Verify MCP Server is Running
```bash
lsof -i :39300
# Shows Pieces OS listening on port 39300 with multiple established connections
```

### 2. Confirm Tools are Available
```bash
curl -N http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse \
  -H 'Accept: text/event-stream' &
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"tools/list"}'
```

**Result:** ✅ Successfully returns tools list with `ask_pieces_ltm` tool schema

### 3. Test create_pieces_memory (Working)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"create_pieces_memory",
      "arguments":{
        "summary":"Test memory",
        "summary_description":"Testing connection"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ✅ `"Long term memory successfully created"`

### 4. Test ask_pieces_ltm (Failing)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":3,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"ask_pieces_ltm",
      "arguments":{
        "question":"What did I work on today?",
        "chat_llm":"claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ❌ `{"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Failed to extract context"}],"isError":true}`

## Attempted Variations (All Failed)

### Minimal Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "hello",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
}
```

### With Application Sources
```json
{
  "question": "What terminal commands have I run recently?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "application_sources": ["Warp"],
  "connected_client": "Warp"
}
```

### Comprehensive Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "What did I work on today?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "connected_client": "Warp",
  "application_sources": ["Warp", "Google Chrome"],
  "topics": ["terminal", "commands", "recent"],
  "related_questions": ["What was I working on?", "What debugging was I doing?"]
}
```

### Different Application Sources Tested
- `["Warp"]`
- `["Google Chrome", "Safari", "Obsidian"]`
- `["Claude"]`
- Multiple combinations from the schema list

**All variations return the same error.**

## Troubleshooting Attempted

1. ✅ **Restarted Pieces MCP server** - Issue persists
2. ✅ **Verified Pieces OS permissions** - Has necessary macOS permissions
3. ✅ **Confirmed LTM data collection** - User sees active workstream data
4. ✅ **Tested different MCP clients** - Same error in Warp Agent Mode, Claude, and direct curl
5. ✅ **Used proper SSE endpoint** - `/sse` for responses, `/messages` for requests
6. ✅ **Verified JSON-RPC format** - Matches working `create_pieces_memory` calls

## Expected Behavior

The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool should return contextual information from the user's LTM data, similar to how the main Pieces application shows workstream summaries and context.

## Actual Behavior

Every call to `ask_pieces_ltm` returns:
```json
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Failed to extract context"
    }
  ],
  "isError": true
}
```

## Analysis

This appears to be an **MCP server implementation issue** where:

1. The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool is properly registered and callable
2. The MCP communication protocol works correctly
3. The underlying LTM system has data and functions properly
4. There's a disconnect between the MCP tool implementation and the LTM data access layer

## Potential Root Causes

1. **Authentication/Session Issue**: MCP server process may lack proper authentication to access LTM data
2. **Data Access Layer Bug**: `ask_pieces_ltm` implementation may be using incorrect API calls to access LTM
3. **Permissions Issue**: MCP server may not have the same data access permissions as the main Pieces application
4. **Initialization Problem**: LTM access for MCP tools may require additional setup or initialization

## Request

Please investigate the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool implementation in the Pieces MCP server to identify why it cannot access the same LTM data that is clearly available to the main Pieces application.

## Additional Context

- Issue occurs consistently across different MCP clients (Warp, Claude)
- `create_pieces_memory` works perfectly, confirming MCP communication
- LTM is actively collecting and displaying data in the main Pieces app
- No relevant error logs found in system logs or Pieces application logs
- Multiple parameter variations attempted with identical results

related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

common_issues.title: Pieces Pro Features Unavailable Despite Upgrade
common_issues.description: Users are reporting inability to access Pieces Pro features after upgrading. Issues include LLM not upgrading to the latest version, browser extensions failing to connect to Pieces OS, and "Pro required" errors for Pro users.  Common factors include recent Pro upgrade, VPN use, and Pieces OS v12.1.1.  Troubleshooting steps like restarting, re-login, and VPN configuration changes haven't resolved the problems.

related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various bugs in the Pieces desktop application, including issues with dragging files into conversation context, sharing snippets via links or GitHub gists, and hotkeys not functioning.  The file dragging issue involves the file choosing window appearing behind other windows and filter rules not applying to all file types. The sharing issue results in failure when attempting to share code snippets.  The hotkey issue involves no hotkeys working and producing a macOS sound. These issues have been reported on Windows and macOS with Pieces OS versions 12.1.0 and 12.1.1.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS services failing to open on MacOS
common_issues.description: Users are unable to open Pieces Settings Service or Pieces Core Services.  Error messages include "Type ZJb is already registered inside GetIt" and websocket connection failures with 404 errors.  This occurs on MacOS versions 15.5 and 15.7 with Pieces OS version 12.1.1. Check for conflicting applications or services, reinstall Pieces OS, and ensure network connectivity.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Settings Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Settings Service
Error: Invalid argument(s): Type ZJb is already registered inside GetIt. 

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: /Applications/Pieces OS.app

**PiecesOS Information**

Current Version: 12.1.1

Max Version Supported: 13.0.0
Local Port: 39300

related_issues.text:

recommendations: Prioritize resolving LTM and Workstream issues on macOS (especially impacting Pro users).  This includes investigating the "Pro membership required" error, LTM data clearing functionality, and general performance/data retrieval problems.
Address Pieces MCP and Desktop app connection issues. Focus on excessive connections from the Desktop app and ensure MCP tools (like ask_pieces_ltm) function reliably.

Investigate why Pro features are unavailable despite user upgrades.  This involves checking LLM version discrepancies, browser extension connectivity, and resolving the "Pro required" error for paying users.
Fix reported Pieces desktop application bugs.  This includes file dragging issues (window placement, filter rules), sharing failures for code snippets, and non-functional hotkeys.
Resolve PiecesOS service failures on MacOS.  Investigate the "Type ZJb already registered" error and websocket connection problems (404 errors) with Settings and Core Services.
